body:
Huh, I swear I remember working on this months ago and considering this exact issue.

Edit: would be interesting to see why [this test](https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/pull/5433/files#diff-4e6412c7bcc831346dd4bb52849daa61aa21e73e58fa9121ba77f5b7915757e8R1494-R1503) is still passing.

issue.title: A spread can return an empty array

issue.title: Two possibly empty lists give non-empty-list after merge

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.title: Fix various array spread issues.

labels.name: release:fix
labels.description: The PR will be included in 'Fixes' section of the release notes

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
- Correctly infer `array` and `list` instead of `non-empty-array` and `non-empty-list` (fixes #7296)
 - Add support for spreading string keys (fixes #7297).
 - Show issue when trying to unpack non-iterable
 - Show issue when trying to unpack iterable with non-array-key key
 - Re-added invalid PHP 8.0 tests removed in #6613
 - Unpacked lists with known keys will be inferred as eg `array{0: int, 1: int}<int<0, max>, int>` now but will still be treated as lists
 - Unpacked arrays with known keys will now be inferred as eg `array{a: string, b: string}<int, int>` instead of `array<int|string, int|string>`
